description: WWW programming, Internet and Intranet applications development, designing and building active server pages and other integrated web-based solutions. 5 hrs (2 class, 3 lab). Prerequisite: CMSC 100 or COI. Offered during First Semester.

Framework of information systems in organizations, enterprise process modeling, and development of collaborative enterprise systems using IT tools and other enabling technologies. 3 hrs (class). Prerequisite: COI. Offered during First Semester.
Fundamental concepts and applications of e-commerce technologies. 5 hrs (2 class, 3 lab). Prerequisite: IT 210 and IT 226 or COI. Offered during Second Semester.
Client/Server computing techniques, system design, software, and applications. 5 hrs (2 class, 3 lab). Prerequisite: CMSC 137 or COI. Offered during First Semester.
Algorithms, IT solutions, and security issues associated with developing applications for the Internet. 5 hrs (2 class, 3 lab). Prerequisite: IT 238 or COI. Offered during First Semester.
Supervised project on the design and development of IT-based applications. Prerequisite: COI. Offered during First Semester, Second Semester, and Midyear.
Seminar on current topics in Information Technology. Prerequisite: COI. Offered during First Semester and Second Semester.
